title: Tom Brady shows support for Patriots ahead of Super Bowl LX after saying he ‘doesn’t have a dog in the fight’
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady initially expressed neutrality about Super Bowl LX, stating he didn't have a 'dog in the fight.'
Brady later showed support for the Patriots with a social media post backing owner Robert Kraft.
Former teammates criticized Brady for his initial comments, citing his strong historical ties to the Patriots.

title: Former Colts Pro Bowl center thinks Drake Maye should have won NFL MVP over Matthew Stafford
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford remain central to NFL MVP debate, with Stafford winning by six points.
Jeff Saturday argued Maye deserved MVP due to stronger all-around play and fewer offensive weapons.
Mina Kimes supported Maye for MVP citing his superior statistics in QBR, EPA, and rushing capability.

title: 5 X-factors for Patriots, Seahawks in Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots to rely on heavy blitzing to pressure Seahawks' quarterback Sam Darnold, who struggles under pressure.
Seattle defense ranks high, but could be vulnerable to Patriots quarterback Drake Maye's scrambling ability.
Patriots' linebacker Robert Spillane's ankle injury could impact their run defense against Seahawks' Kenneth Walker.

title: Patriots get good Drake Maye news on final injury report, but 2 captains are listed as questionable
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots quarterback Drake Maye has no injury designation and is expected to play in Sunday's Super Bowl.
Patriots linebackers Harold Landry and Robert Spillane are listed as questionable due to knee and ankle injuries, respectively.
Rookie defensive lineman Joshua Farmer is also questionable for Patriots with a hamstring injury but participated in all practices this week.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Hell or High Water' featuring Chris Pine and Ben Foster is now streaming on Netflix.
'Splitsville', a 2025 romantic comedy with Dakota Johnson, is available on Hulu.
The 2026 Winter Olympics are streaming on Peacock, including NBC's tape-delayed coverage.

title: ‘We all we got, we all we need’: How Stefon Diggs’s  voice sparked a New England rallying cry
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Stefon Diggs's phrase 'we all we got, we all we need' ignites a rallying cry for New England Patriots.
Diggs inspired teammates with the phrase during a key game against Buffalo Bills, sparking a dramatic season turnaround.
Diggs faces legal issues but remains a vocal leader as Patriots prepare for Super Bowl LX against Seahawks.

title: She’s running her first-ever marathon to raise money for Mass. General Hospital
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Armanda Demeris, 34, from North Attleboro, is running her first marathon for the Massachusetts General Hospital Fund.
Demeris seeks to support Emergency Response, Cancer Care, and the Home Base Program through her marathon fundraising.
The Boston Marathon marks her personal goal, combining athletic achievement with supporting causes meaningful to her family.

title: Foodie’s Markets to close South End location, resulting in neighborhood outcry
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Foodie's Markets is closing its South End location after 28 years, sparking community opposition.
The Croft School initially planned to use the vacated space, but withdrew due to neighborhood concerns.
A petition with over 1,500 signatures urges keeping the space for retail or food purposes.

title: The anonymous Drake Maye Lover Instagram account has developed quite the following
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: The Instagram account @DrakeMayeLover, started in May 2024, boasts nearly 400,000 followers.
Drake Maye, New England Patriots quarterback, acknowledges the account which often shares memes and merchandise.
The owner of @DrakeMayeLover intends to reveal their identity after obtaining a photo with Maye.

title: Tom Brady’s Super Bowl LX neutrality strikes a nerve with Patriots fans
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tom Brady expressed neutrality on Super Bowl LX featuring the Patriots and Seahawks, causing mixed reactions among Patriots fans.
Brady's neutral stance comes during his transition to broadcasting and minority ownership with the Raiders.
Nearly 700 Boston.com readers shared varied opinions, with some feeling disappointment and others understanding Brady's position.
